title: Remove wheel navigation and replace with a simpler new navigation mechanic

requirements.text: Remove the wheel-based navigation mechanic from the app, including its UI, hooks, and styling, so no wheel navigation is rendered or referenced anywhere in the reel experience.

quotes: Delete the wheel and go back to something simple and not out yet create something new

acceptanceCriteria: WheelNavScroller is no longer imported or rendered (including on the ReelHome page and empty-feed state).
The wheel-scroller hook is no longer used anywhere in the app.
Wheel-specific CSS utilities/classes are removed or no longer referenced so they do not affect layout/behavior.
The reel feed scroll behavior is not blocked by any remaining wheel event listeners.

requirements.text: Implement a new simple, popular-feeling navigation mechanic (not a wheel) that is consistently available in the reel-first experience and is easy to use on mobile and desktop.
acceptanceCriteria: A replacement navigation UI is available on the main reel route ('/'), providing one-tap access to core sections (Home/Reel, Discover, Create Post, Messages, Profile, Hub).
Navigation supports mouse/touch and keyboard accessibility (tab focus + Enter/Space activation) with clear English labels/aria-labels.
Create Post opens the existing create-post flow/modal (no broken navigation or dead buttons).
The new navigation does not interfere with vertical scroll-snap usage on the reel feed.

requirements.text: Update the reel page and any related layout logic so the new navigation mechanic replaces the wheel without introducing duplicate/confusing navigation patterns.

quotes: Delete the wheel and go back to something simple

acceptanceCriteria: ReelHome uses the new navigation component instead of WheelNavScroller (including the empty-feed state).
The navigation appears in a single, consistent place on the reel route (no duplicated wheel + bottom nav combinations).
All navigation targets route correctly using the existing router paths ('/', '/discover', '/messages', '/profile', '/hub').

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinct visual theme across the new navigation and reel experience that feels modern and addictive while staying simple (avoid blue/purple as the primary identity unless already present).
acceptanceCriteria: The navigation component has a consistent visual style (colors, typography, spacing, states) that matches the rest of the app.
Active/selected state is clearly visible and accessible (sufficient contrast, not color-only).
User-facing text in the new UI is in English.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only shadcn components); compose them instead.
Do not edit immutable hook/entry files listed by the platform (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Backend must remain single-actor (Motoko) and unchanged unless strictly required for navigation changes.
nonGoals: Do not add new backend features, schemas, or persistence to support the navigation change.
Do not implement third-party auth or external integrations.
Do not change existing route structure beyond what is necessary to swap the navigation UI.
